page.title: 09TRANSPORT-YALDING & DISTRICT
page.content: Yalding has long been an important bridging place of the rivers Beult and Medway. Roads B2010 and B2162 carry much traffic through Yalding including heavy lorries to and from Paddock Wood. Bow Bridge, Wateringbury carries a minor road. On B2015 Wateringbury & Nettlestead have Maidstone-Tunbridge Wells traffic. Most families have a car. The Strood-Paddock Wood line serves Wateringbury & Yalding railway stations. The daily hourly electric trains in each direction are augmented on Mondays to Fridays in peak hours. Passengers change at Paddock Wood and Strood for main line trains. Sunday services start slightly later and finish slightly earlier. There is through freight traffic, but none to or from Wateringbury or Yalding stations.
